comments: Also LCM of common divisors of n and sigma[n]. It equals n if n is multiply perfect. - _Labos Elemer_, Aug 14 2002A000005(a(n)) = A073802(n). [From _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 12 2010]A006530(a(n)) = A082062(n). [_Reinhard Zumkeller_, Jul 10 2011]a(A014567(n)) = 1; A069059(a(n)) > 1. - _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 23 2013
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
P. Pollack, On the greatest common divisor of a number and its sum of divisors, Michigan Math. J. Volume 60, Issue 1 (2011), 199-214.
prog: (Haskell)a009194 n = gcd (a000203 n) n  -- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Mar 23 2013(PARI) a(n) = gcd(n, sigma(n)); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Oct 23 2013
author: _David W. Wilson_
